channel.title: 40 channel 14 bit dac possible?
channel.description:
Hi! As there are now cheap clones of the CURTIS 33XX synthesizer chips available. I thought it might be cool to use axoloti as the brain for lets say 8 vcos 8vcfs 8adsr 8vcas and 3lfos or even more.. or less... = ) if there where like 64 cv outputs available the axoloti interface would make it so easy to organize the behaviour of all those micromodules like this one https://hackaday.io/project/160538-cem3340-module
I wondered why those polyphonic midi cv interfaces are so expensive (~300€) and I found that Analog Devices offers and evaluation board for an 40channel 14bit dac for 136€ (conrad) which should do the job very well or am I wrong? https://octopart.com/eval-ad5371ebz-analog+devices-12441087
Do you think it should be possible to easily control the 40 outputs of this evaluation board using axoloti? best regards, Flub

item.title: 40 channel 14 bit dac possible?
item.dc:creator: @Flub Flo
item.description:
@Flub wrote:

Hi! As there are now cheap clones of the CURTIS 33XX synthesizer chips available. I thought it might be cool to use axoloti as the brain for lets say 8 vcos 8vcfs 8adsr 8vcas and 3lfos or even more.. or less... = )
if there where like 64 cv outputs available the axoloti interface would make it so easy to organize the behaviour of all those micromodules like this one https://hackaday.io/project/160538-cem3340-module

I wondered why those polyphonic midi cv interfaces are so expensive (~300€) and I found that Analog Devices offers and evaluation board for an 40channel 14bit dac for 136€ (conrad) which should do the job very well or am I wrong?
https://octopart.com/eval-ad5371ebz-analog+devices-12441087

Do you think it should be possible to easily control the 40 outputs of this evaluation board using axoloti?
best regards,
Flub
